attacks.effect: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attacks.name: Jet Screw
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: It used to have a shell on its back long ago. This species is closely related to Pokémon like Shellder.
They normally inhabit rocky seashores, but in times of continuous rain, they can sometimes be found in the mountains, far from the sea.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

description: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {F} Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description: This Rotom has entered a washing machine. It nods with satisfaction after it floods the surrounding area.
This Rotom has entered a refrigerator. It leaps around gleefully after it uses cold air to freeze the area around it.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Storm
attacks.effect: Discard 3 {W} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oceanic Gift
attacks.effect: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon.

description: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

description: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

attacks.name: Exciting Voltage
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {L} Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

description: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.effect: Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sparking Gadget
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

description: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

attacks.name: Assault Laser
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they've hardly been seen at all.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does +60 damage.

description: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

attacks.name: Magical Delusion
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
If it finds bad children who won't listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it's said.
It seeks drifting will-o'-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.
At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.

abilities.name: Shadow Void
abilities.effect: As often as you like during your turn, you may choose 1 of your Pokémon that has damage on it, and move all of its damage to this Pokémon.

description: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.

Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said
that it can wipe out the memory of those who see
its eyes.

attacks.name: Mind Boost
attacks.effect: Take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to Mesprit or Azelf.

description:
Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught
humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attacks.name: Supreme Blast
attacks.effect: You can use this attack only if you have Uxie and Azelf on your Bench. Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the
bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

attacks.name: Psychic Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Moonlight Gain
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.

attacks.name: Mountain Swing
attacks.effect: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

description: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

description: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.
It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
Every bit of Regirock's body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what's been lost.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.

attacks.name: Head Smash
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.

abilities.name: Fighting Coach
abilities.effect: Attacks used by your {F} Pokémon do +20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.

attacks.name: Energized Blade
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Scratching Nails
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

description: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.
It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

attacks.name: Swirling Disaster
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Group Beatdown
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

attacks.name: Group Beatdown
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

attacks.name: Dark Void
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Nightmare Aura
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach a {D} Energy from your Energy Zone to this Pokémon, do 20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: Registeel's body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.
A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.

abilities.name: Guarded Grill
abilities.effect: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon takes −100 damage from that attack.

description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

description: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don't come back.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Metallic Turbo
attacks.effect: Take 2 {M} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

description: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.

abilities.name: Reckless Shearing
abilities.effect: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Licking Fury
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z's behavior.

attacks.name: Buggy Beam

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.effect: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Single-Horn Throw

description:
To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers
itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, attacks used by this Pokémon cost 1 less {C} Energy.

abilities.name: Snowy Terrain

description: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.

attacks.name: Zone Smash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

description: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

description: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

description: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

attacks.name: Astonish

description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

abilities.name: CHECK

description: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Speed Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

description: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

attacks.name: Fighting Headbutt
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon {ex}, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won't be able to settle down unless it washes its body.
Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.

attacks.name: Rolling Spin
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Rolling Spin attack does +60 damage.

description: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

abilities.name: Power Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, attacks used by this Pokémon do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Kick Shot
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Linear Attack

attacks.name: Time Mash

With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

attacks.name: Psychic Suppression

description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Chaotic Impact
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Chest-ouflage

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit's rebirth as this Pokémon.
People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.

attacks.name: Pierce the Pain
attacks.effect: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that have damage on them.

description: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull's head. The caps regrow overnight.
Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

attacks.name: Flickering Light
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

description: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

description: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attacks.name: Three Kick Combo
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

description: It's nature's cleaner—it eats anything and everything,  including garbage and rotten things. The ground near  its nest is always clean.

abilities.name: Wimp Out
abilities.effect: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

description: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Anchor Shot
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description: Although it's called a guardian deity, it's violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

attacks.name: Stuck-In Tackle
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.
This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and dances through the night as a way to mourn its fallen allies.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If at least 1 of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

description: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

description: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they've grown close, but it's a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scar-Charged Smash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from both Active Pokémon.

description: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

attacks.name: Heated Poison
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

description: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

description: Life on mountains covered with deep snow has granted this Pokémon a body of ice that's as hard as steel.
It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through deep snow as it runs. On snowy mountains, this Sandslash is faster than any other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack, do 40 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.effect: Take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description: A deity resides in the snowy mountains where this Pokémon lives. In ancient times, it was worshiped as that deity's incarnation.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn't know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.

abilities.name: Melodious Healing
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 30 damage from each of your {W} Pokémon.

attacks.name: Insatiable Striking
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Insatiable Striking attack does +40 damage.

description: Individually, they're incredibly weak. It's by gathering up into schools that they're able to confront opponents.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Wishiwashi or Wishiwashi ex from your deck onto your Bench.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi ex.

description: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claws
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

abilities.name: Innards Out
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 50 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

When two Graveler fight each other, it fills the
surroundings with flashes of light and sound.
People call it the “fireworks of the earth.”
It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

description: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.
One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

description: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.effect: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex.

description: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.

description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

attacks.name: Barrier Shove
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

description: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.

attacks.name: Psycharge
attacks.effect: Take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.
It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.
This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.

attacks.name: Night Bind
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't take any Energy from their Energy Zone to attach to their Active Pokémon.

description: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description: This form of Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. It uses ethereal dance steps to call forth the spirits of the dead.

attacks.name: Spiteful Dance
attacks.effect: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs' effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won't wither once they're attached to a Comfey.

abilities.name: Flower Shield
abilities.effect: Each of your Pokémon that has any {P} Energy attached recovers from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

description: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu's old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

attacks.name: Shadow Hit
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon.

description: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

attacks.name: Energy Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy attached to that Pokémon.

description: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it
the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −50 damage from attacks.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

description: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It's apparently from another world.

attacks.name: Prismatic Laser
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.effect: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

description: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

description: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card that evolves from Rockruff from your deck into your hand.

description: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.

attacks.name: Blood Fang
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

description: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won't dry out even if it's exposed to the sun for a long time.
This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Offload Pass
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move all {F} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.

attacks.name: Star Drop
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description: It shows no interest in anything that isn't fresh. If you take it shopping with you, it will help you pick out ingredients.
It has an incredibly greedy personality. Its nest is filled with so much food gathered by Rattata at its direction, it can't possibly eat it all.

attacks.name: Scrounge-and-Scarf
attacks.effect: Discard a random Item card from your opponent's hand.

description: It's accustomed to luxury because it used to live with Alolan royalty. As a result, it's very picky about food.
The round face of Alolan Persian is considered to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region, so these Pokémon are very well cared for.

abilities.name: Fur Coat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

attacks.name: Chemical Panic
attacks.effect: 1 Special Condition from among Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, and Poisoned is chosen at random, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. Any Special Conditions already affecting that Pokémon will not be chosen.

description: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description: The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.
Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of protective helmet on their heads, and they also function as highly precise sensors.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

description: It's not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill's rampant digging.
Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description: Once it absorbs a key's metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.

attacks.name: Unlock
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

description: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

attacks.name: Silver Cannon
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has an Ability, this attack does 40 more damage.

description: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.effect: If any of your Benched Pokémon have damage on them, this attack does 50 more damage.

description: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

attacks.name: Clanging Scales
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes +30 damage from attacks.

description: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it's a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

description: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.effect: Take a {C} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.

attacks.name: Justified Press
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {D} Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

description: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Confused.

description: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.

attacks.name: Primate's Trap
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost 1 {C} more, and its Retreat Cost is 1 {C} more.

description: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.

abilities.name: Comatose
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever you attach an Energy from your Energy Zone to it, it is now Asleep.

description: Blazing sunlight has brought out the true form and powers of this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hammer
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

description: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
Each of Exeggutor's three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don't seem to be very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

description: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you'll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Bother
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

description: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

abilities.name: Comforting Song
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Swing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Hydro Bazooka
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

abilities.name: Shadowy Spellbind
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

description:
The leaves on its head grow right back even if
they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those
who eat them.

The fragrance of the garland on its head has
a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very
difficult.

It sends its feathers, which are as sharp
as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong,
so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

description:
This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you
don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at
opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss,
it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

attacks.name: Sniping Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 70 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Beat
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Big Beat.

description:
A life-form that lives in another world, its body
is thin and supple, but it also possesses
great power.

attacks.name: Jump Blues
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin
as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the
explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Beat Punk
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

description:
If it builds up enough speed swimming, it
can jump out above the waves and glide
for over 300 feet.

It won't attack while it's alone—not even if it
spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to
join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.

As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo
will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling
toward the target to attack at 75 mph.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
The extension and contraction of its muscles
generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

Strong electricity courses through the tips of
its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting
in foes.

It can see clearly through walls to track down its
prey and seek its lost young.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon do −20 damage.

description:
When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear.
It can catch lightning with its mane and store
the electricity.

When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it
shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles
with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can
cause a lot of trouble.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently
a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

attacks.name: Electronica
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents
apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack,
they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Flash
abilities.effect: At the end of your first turn, take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
It is said that happiness will come to those who
see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a
full moon.

A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will
run and hide the moment it senses people.

With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to
lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost
among the trees.

People fear it due to a belief that it devours any
who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the
Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.

It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone
seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to
sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing,
it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

description:
It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens
its inner strength through meditation.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

description:
Through yoga training, it gained the psychic
power to predict its foe's next move.

It moves while spinning around on its single foot.
Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on
their heads.

This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient
clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.effect: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

description:
This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young.
Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures,
but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

attacks.name: Lycanfang
attacks.effect: Discard a {F} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries.
It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls
without skill.

attacks.name: Let's Throw
attacks.effect: If Passimian is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

description:
If it loses its shovel, it will stick something
else—like a branch—in its head to make
do until it finds another shovel.

The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon
into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped,
it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description:
It's accustomed to luxury because it
used to live with Alolan royalty. As a
result, it's very picky about food.

attacks.name: Meddle
attacks.effect: Discard a random Pokémon Tool card from your opponent's hand.

description:
The round face of Alolan Persian is considered
to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region,
so these Pokémon are very well cared for.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description:
It submerges itself in sand and moves as if
swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies
from finding it and maintains its temperature.

Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see
even in the dead of night. They live in groups of
a few individuals.

After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it
twists its body around to rip its prey in half.

attacks.name: Poaching Fangs
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, a card is chosen at random from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

description:
A life-form from another world, it was dubbed
a UB and is thought to produce a
strong neurotoxin.

attacks.name: New Wave
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon takes +10 damage from being Poisoned.

attacks.name: Grindcore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be
chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: 2-Step
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description:
It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid
inside its body. It is one of the organisms known
as UBs.

attacks.name: Electro House
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat
caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.

attacks.name: Happened to Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Triplet Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

description:
It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks—
to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory
by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate
thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by
ramming into them horn first.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

description:
It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging
to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks,
and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb
the nutrients it finds within the stone.

abilities.name: Steel Spikes
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description:
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one
appears to be made up of many life-forms
stacked one on top of each other.

attacks.name: Brass Rock
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description:
This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious.
It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect
information about its surroundings.

Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon.
So much so that there's a theory that Herdier was
the first Pokémon to partner with people.

These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans.
Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up
to people in about three days.

abilities.name: Guard Dog Visage
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost 1 {C} more.

description:
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out
to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show
its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is
dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Superpowered Hug
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

description:
It normally spends its time meditating in the
treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other
Pokémon orders as it pleases.

A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific
mission, it went berserk during an experiment,
so it was cryogenically frozen.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

description:
This is its form once it has awakened and
evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is
greatly increased.

huge arms.
