description:
It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders
with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless
shuddering.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description:
As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many
hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously
soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
There is a plant seed on its back right from the
day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly
grows larger.

The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units
at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which
allows it to float.

attacks.name: Inferno Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. Take an amount of {R} Energy from your Energy Zone equal to the number of heads and attach it to your Benched {R} Pokémon in any way you like.

description:
When it is angered, it immediately discharges the
energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements
swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot
parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is
revered as an embodiment of the sun.

attacks.name: Volcanic Ash
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause
fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

description:
Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads
over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust.
Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
It has a preference for hot things. When it rains,
steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it
squirts out water with vigorous force.

It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to
bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
It uses its whole body to photosynthesize when
exposed to sunlight. Its shell is made from
hardened soil.

The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon
produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse.
The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

attacks.name: Exciting Voltage
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {L} Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

abilities.name: Lunar Plumage
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone to this Pokémon, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon startles people in the middle of
the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed
feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element
in heraldic designs.

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly.
Even rain can't extinguish the fire.

The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said
that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

abilities.name: Nightmare Aura
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach a {D} Energy from your Energy Zone to this Pokémon, do 20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes
this form. It's full of energy while it's like this,
and its liveliness will go on until sundown.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
Its tail discharges electricity into the ground,
protecting it from getting shocked.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Resilience Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

description:
It moves less than an inch a year, but when
it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the
ground in a split second.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

description:
It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy
passes by, it leaps out and chomps them.
The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave
the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

abilities.name: Defensive Whirlwind
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks from {F} Pokémon.

description:
It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond
with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oceanic Gift
attacks.effect: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon.

description:
It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds
of food every day. When it is done eating, it
goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {P} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to
ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of
this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

attacks.name: Overacceleration
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overacceleration attack does +20 damage.

description:
Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants.
This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep
it from drying out.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.effect: Put 1 random {G} Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

description:
With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people
on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attacks.name: Attack the Wound
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once
it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies
with lightning-fast movements.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description:
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its
opponents with ceaseless punches and chops
from all angles.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger
than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is
more agile and active than it appears.

It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric
cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.

description:
They communicate with one another using their
auras. They are able to run all through the night.

Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs,
it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates
with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.effect: Take a {G} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back.
The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise
take when attacked.

The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves
as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and
cannot be seen from the ground.

attacks.name: Spiral Rush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Draco Meteor

attacks.name: Draco Meteor
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is chosen at random 4 times. For each time a Pokémon was chosen, do 40 damage to it.

description:
This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by
sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides
itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

attacks.name: Shadow Hit
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon.

description:
Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown
away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
Lycanroc attacks its prey with its
sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys
the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
Blazing sunlight has brought out the true
form and powers of this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hammer
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description: A deity resides in the snowy mountains where this Pokémon lives. In ancient times, it was worshiped as that deity's incarnation.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon punches trees and eats
the berries that drop down, training itself
and getting food at the same time.

There are a hundred or so of them living in
Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard
workers who eat a lot of trash.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate.
The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.

attacks.name: Beak Blast
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

description:
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents
apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack,
they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Flash
abilities.effect: At the end of your first turn, take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin
as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the
explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Beat Punk
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

description:
Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently
a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

attacks.name: Electronica
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
Lunala no longer has a will of its own. Now under the
control of Necrozma, it continuously expels all of its energy.

attacks.name: Psychobilly
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

description:
This is its form while it is devouring the light of
Solgaleo. It pounces on foes and then slashes
them with the claws on its four limbs and back.

attacks.name: Black Metal
attacks.effect: Discard a {M} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one
appears to be made up of many life-forms
stacked one on top of each other.

attacks.name: Brass Rock
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Shoegaze
attacks.effect: Discard the top 5 cards of each player's deck.

description:
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be
chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: 2-Step
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description:
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out
to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself
comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to
cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

description:
It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted
by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Beginning Bolt
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

description:
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them
to berries it's decorated with cream.

attacks.name: Sweets Overload
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage for each time your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during this game.

description:
They say that if it emits an aura from its whole
body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers,
Audino can gauge other creatures' feelings and physical conditions.

attacks.name: Drain Slap
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon
takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon.
It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

attacks.name: Bristling Spikes
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack, do 30 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping
them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.

attacks.name: Enhanced Fang
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen
in places where shooting stars have fallen.

attacks.name: Twinkly Call
attacks.effect: Put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

description:
Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle
currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits
out pitch-black ink and escapes.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both
positive and negative charges flowing through them.

attacks.name: Luring Glow
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

description:
If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its
mouth, the pain will never go away.

attacks.name: Diving Swipe
attacks.effect: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

description:
Although it's carrying its baby in a pouch on
its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It
intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Happy Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can
stay dry even when it plays in the water.

Evolution made it even more devious.
It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey
and then either splits the prey in half or flings
it away.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
The influence of Mega Evolution leaves it in a
state of constant excitement. It pierces enemies
with its two large horns before shredding them.

attacks.name: Critical Scissors
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

description:
It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels
attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for
evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks if that damage is 40 or less.

description:
It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its
long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
It never forgets any attack it endured while in the
cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks if that damage is 40 or less.

description:
It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust
when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

attacks.name: Select Powder
attacks.effect: Choose either Poisoned or Confused. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

description:
It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of
its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound
of Nuzleaf's grass flute fills listeners with dread.

It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to
create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

attacks.name: Nipping Cyclone
attacks.effect: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

description:
If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top
of its head to protect itself.

The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores.
It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible
punches.

It's good at finding berries and gathers them from
all over. It's kind enough to share them
with friends.

Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail
around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is
very bitter.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description:
It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself.
If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds,
it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

description:
If the leaves on its head are pruned with
regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into
a fine plump shape.

No matter how much time and money is spent
raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when
they bloom in the wild.

abilities.name: Toughness Aroma
abilities.effect: Each of your {G} Pokémon gets +20 HP.

description:
Arid regions are their habitat. They move
rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick
movements, slicing them up with its horns.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword.

description:
As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can
make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing
it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.

These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous
places. The victor in their contests of clashing
horns will become the leader of the herd.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

description:
With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to
lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost
among the trees.

Small roots that extend from the tips of this
Pokémon's feet can tie into the trees of the
forest and give Trevenant control over them.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
It attacks with rapid beats of its stick.
As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets
more and more pumped.

When it's drumming out rapid beats in battle, it
gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won't even
notice that it's already knocked out its opponent.

The one with the best drumming techniques
becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle
disposition and values harmony among its group.

abilities.name: Captivating Rhythm
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

description:
It's very friendly and faithful to people. It will try
to repel enemies by barking and biting.

Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty.
Anyone hearing it can't help but grovel before it.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

description:
If you've been accepted by Ponyta, its burning
mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

attacks.name: Sprinting Flare
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by
shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

attacks.name: Blessed Burn
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

description:
A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug.
It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases.
Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from
its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear
over buildings.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from
its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over
buildings.

attacks.name: Mega Burning
attacks.effect: Discard Fire{R} Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

description:
This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes.
The fire within the tuft on its head can reach
600 degrees Fahrenheit.

When it gets excited, embers rise from its head
and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it
loves sweets.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description:
This popular symbol of good fortune will never
fall over in its sleep, no matter how it's pushed
or pulled.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

description:
This Pokémon's power level rises along with the
temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500
degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Darmani-Hands
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

description:
The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs,
the brighter and eerier the flame on its
head burns.

It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp.
Once it finds someone whose death is near,
it will trail quietly after them.

In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of
lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—
or so it's said.

abilities.name: Slow Sear
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

description:
A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the
hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour
their insides.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by
battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane
will grow.

The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over
3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely
approaching it will cause severe burns.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes
explosive compounds to develop in its shell.
Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

attacks.name: Shell Trap
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description:
If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit
odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an
episode.

It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow-
moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.

In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than
the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Waterfall Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card from your deck that evolves from this Pokémon onto this Pokémon to evolve it.

description:
It appears whenever there is world conflict,
burning down any place it travels through.

attacks.name: Hammering Tail
attacks.effect: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

description:
Mega Evolution also affects its brain, leaving
no other function except its destructive instinct
to burn everything to cinders.

attacks.name: Mega Blaster
attacks.effect: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

description:
Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land.
That is how it began to live floating in the water.

It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny.
It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and
becomes active at night.

If it hears festive music, it begins moving in
rhythm in order to amplify its power.

attacks.name: Rhythmic Steps
attacks.effect: If you have exactly 1, 3, or 5 cards in your hand, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
When it sucks in a large volume of seawater,
it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton
of food daily.

The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth
of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

attacks.name: Whale Pump
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 more damage for each {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon.

description:
It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped
to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will
crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc
congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.

attacks.name: Paired Tackle
attacks.effect: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of
nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs
low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with
its tail.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description:
It uses sound waves to communicate with
others of its kind. People and other Pokémon
species can't hear its cries of warning.

On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to
the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their
bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

This Pokémon is popular among the elderly,
who say the vibrations of its lumps are great
for massages.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of
many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life
from a fossil.

This Pokémon emerges from the water in search
of prey despite the fact that it moves more
slowly on land.

attacks.name: Blocking Shell
attacks.effect: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

description:
Legend has it that the residents of a sunken
ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky,
schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of
the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

abilities.name: Bouncy Body
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of
oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword.

description:
It protects its skin by covering its body in
delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air,
it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

Its swiftness is unparalleled.
It can scale a tower of more
than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Shifting Stream
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may switch your Active {W} Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold.
On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an
Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.

This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten
anything that gets in its way. When it's floating
out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description:
A popular game among children is to lift up sticks
that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose
Chewtle can hang on the longest.

Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey
come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck
out and chomps down on them.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description:
It takes down prey by charging into them with
its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda's eyesight is
poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.

It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging
forward at speeds of over 100 knots before
ramming prey and spearing into them.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

description:
If you lick the ice covering its face, you'll find it
has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on
ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.

abilities.name: Ice Face
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon has full HP, it takes −40 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Wall
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy from their Energy Zone to 1 of their Pokémon, do 20 damage to that Pokémon.

description:
Its fleece grows continually. In the summer,
the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in
a week.

Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin,
it can store lots of electricity in its fur.

When it gets dark, the light from its bright,
shiny tail can be seen from far away on the
ocean's surface.

attacks.name: Zapping Bullet
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon is chosen at random. This attack also does 20 damage to it.

description:
The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from
far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

attacks.name: Lightning Lancer
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon is chosen at random 3 times. For each time a Pokémon was chosen, also do 20 damage to it.

description:
The extension and contraction of its muscles
generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's
in trouble.

By gathering their tails together, they collectively
generate powerful electricity from their claws.

Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in
handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches
together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Attack the Wound
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
Its mane shines when it discharges electricity.
They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes
to communicate.

They have lightning-like movements.
When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of
thunder reverberates.

Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon.
It's soaking up static electricity because it can't
produce a charge on its own.

It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests
of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are
not yet good at flying.

Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers
on their cheeks to communicate with each other.
When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.

attacks.name: Electric Nibbling
attacks.effect: Discard a {L} Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with
their work because it wants treats. As it runs,
it crackles with electricity.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.effect: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

description:
It sends electricity through its legs to boost their
strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks
50 mph.

Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to
hop to get around. It is always staring
at something.

This odd Pokémon can see both the past and
the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

It loves to bite and yank people's hair from
behind without warning, just to see their
shocked reactions.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description:
Its cries sound like incantations to torment the
foe. It appears where you least expect it.

Materials from gems it has eaten float to the
surface of its body and can form an infinite
number of patterns among individuals.

attacks.name: Dirty Throw
attacks.effect: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't, this attack does nothing.

description:
On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and
blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful
soprano.

attacks.name: Mega Harmony
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to
prey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
It seeks drifting will-o'-the-wisps and sucks them
into its empty body. What happens inside is
a mystery.

With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its
target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten—
Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.

abilities.name: Fade into Darkness
abilities.effect: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't get any points for it.

description:
It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for
just one week every thousand years.

attacks.name: Star Drop
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old
folktale calls it a "signpost for wandering spirits."

attacks.name: Wind Blast
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
They carry people and Pokémon, but the
wind can catch them, so there can't be a
fixed destination.

attacks.name: Balloon Barrage
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

description:
There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops,
the orb bounces all over and makes a
ringing sound.

attacks.name: Jingly Noise
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

description:
The spirit of a person from a bygone age became
this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching
for someone who knows its face.

There are many depictions of Cofagrigus
decorating ancient tombs. They're symbols
of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

attacks.name: Soul Shot
attacks.effect: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you can't discard 2 cards, this attack does nothing.

description:
Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers
that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin
bawling if you do.

Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to
form the shapes of constellations. Some people
believe this Pokémon came from outer space.

It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts
somewhat detached because it has seen the end
of all existence.

attacks.name: Stellar Cradle
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if they attach Energy from their Energy Zone to the Defending Pokémon, that Pokémon will be Asleep.

description:
The scent its body gives off enraptures those
who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of
love for Spritzee.

The scents Aromatisse can produce range from
sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells
that sap an opponent's will to fight.

attacks.name: Confounding Cologne
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

description:
The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes
Swirlix's fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out
sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description:
Slurpuff's fur contains a lot of air, making it soft
to the touch and lighter than it looks.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
It's said that somewhere in the world, there's
a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering
Carbink. It's also said that this pack has a queen.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

description:
In the past, noble families entrusted their vault
keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down
through the generations, taking good care of it.

abilities.name: Dismantling Keys
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you do, discard this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

description:
It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If
hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp
claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

attacks.name: Quick Straight
attacks.effect: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

description:
To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but
mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
It toughens up by slamming into thick trees
over and over. It gains a sturdy body and
dauntless spirit.

It stomps on the ground to build power.
It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a
straight-arm punch.

attacks.name: Slapping Knockdown
attacks.effect: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs.
It travels easily through the sands of the desert.

It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of
fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of
sand while attacking.

attacks.name: Crashing Fangs
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

description:
They live hidden under hot desert sands in order
to keep their body temperature from dropping.

Thanks to the special membrane covering its
eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in
the middle of the night.

Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey
more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of
a sandstorm.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp Bite
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird
Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries
and bug Pokémon.

Though capable of flight, Archeops was
apparently better at hunting on the ground.

attacks.name: Wild Spin
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon's Wild Spin attack does +20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon was created from clay. It received
orders from its master many thousands of years
ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

There's a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual
motion machine that produces limitless energy,
but this belief hasn't been proven.

attacks.name: Heavy Rocket
attacks.effect: Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of 3 or more you find there. Shuffle the revealed cards back into your deck.

description:
It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush
anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword.

description:
Wanting to make sure it's taken seriously,
Pancham's always giving others a glare.
But if it's not focusing, it ends up smiling.

If it loses its pincers, they'll quickly regrow.
The pincers are popular ingredients in paella
since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.

Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon's
movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles
from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.

attacks.name: Last-Chance Punch
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 30 or less, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may
be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is
flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

The moves it uses to take down its prey would
make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued
prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to
close in on them while they're blinded, but since
Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

description:
From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones
of its victims, which are all dried up after being
drained of their vitality.

attacks.name: Life Sucker
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon's body
that have grown old and flaked off have long
been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.

Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of
coal on Carkol's back never falls apart, even
when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.

It's gentle usually but fearsome when angered.
With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees
Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.

attacks.name: Coal Drop
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {G} Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
If spotted, it will lure an unwary person
into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on
mountain trails.

A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and
more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will
assemble.

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

description:
Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect
danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer
of doom.

attacks.name: Ominous Claw
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a Supporter card you find there and discard it.

description:
As the energy of Mega Evolution fills it, its fur
bristles. What you see on its back are not true
wings, and this Pokémon isn't able to fly.

attacks.name: Darkness Claw
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a Supporter card you find there and discard it.

description:
It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked
in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this
Pokémon's poison seeps in.

It's so vicious that it's called the Sand Demon.
Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion
keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Paralyzed.

description:
It can lull people to sleep and make them dream.
It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description:
It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce,
so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that
moves and attempt to eat it.

The two heads have different likes and dislikes.
Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous
gets stronger without needing to rely on others.

It's said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because
people in times long past loathed it, considering
it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.

attacks.name: Hyper Ray
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Roar in Unison
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take 2 {D} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon. If you do, do 30 damage to this Pokémon.

description:
Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of
its opponents. It strikes with punches that can
turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does +30 damage.

description:
This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it's caught in
a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far
away and become unable to return to its home.

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs
that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter,
astringent flavor—they're not suitable as food.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over
areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the
odds are always against it.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 70 more damage.

description:
They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks
on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.

This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and
turns them into energy. It's popular with people
who tend to think gloomy thoughts.

attacks.name: False Surrender
attacks.effect: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving
into this splendid form, it hasn't given up on its
petty misdeeds and pranks.

Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings.
Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed's
spikes grow big and strong.

Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon
crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes
on its feelers into the stone.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description:
They lay their eggs deep inside their nests.
When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate
using their massive mandibles.

attacks.name: Bite Together
attacks.effect: If Durant is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

description:
It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its
allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword.

description:
The blue eye on the sword's handguard is the
true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it
drains people's lives away.

The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly
alternating between offense and defense to
bring down their prey.

Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash
reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually
drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

abilities.name: Cursed Metal
abilities.effect: Attacks used by your {P} Pokémon and {M} Pokémon do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid
metal within its body is how it generates energy.

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
Although its wings have partly turned to steel and
become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies
through the skies with ease.

attacks.name: Iron Wings
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {M} Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −50 damage from attacks.

description:
Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up
residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon,
treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

attacks.name: Giga Claw
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

description:
Goomy's horns are excellent sensory organs that
cover all five of Goomy's senses. Goomy picks
up on danger from the movement of the air.

abilities.name: Sticky Membrane
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost 1 {C} more.

description:
When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating
its entire body becomes more concentrated—
it'll dissolve anything.

This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged.
It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with
enough power to send a dump truck flying.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict.
If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

Very protective of its sprawling territorial area,
this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate
enemies. It races through the skies at
Mach-2 speed.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

description:
Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is
exposed to radiation from element stones.

abilities.name: Boosted Evolution
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, it can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

description:
It searches for prey from the tops of trees.
When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet,
Aipom gets excited and pounces.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description:
It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both
of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze,
that's proof it really likes you.

attacks.name: Excited Tail
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If this Pokémon has Lucky Mittens attached, flip 4 coins instead.

description:
This Pokémon needs to be milked every day,
or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk
changes with the seasons.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description:
A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an
interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws
to bring down prey. Running along winding
paths is not its strong suit.

When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice
startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder.
It cries until it's exhausted, then it falls asleep.

The force of this Pokémon's loud voice isn't just
the sound—it's also the wave of air pressure that
blows opponents away and damages them.

This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To
communicate with others of its kind, it'll emit all
sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

attacks.name: Booming Roar
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

description:
It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail
until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
It is highly popular among female Trainers for its
sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

abilities.name: Search for Friends
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

description:
Each Spinda's spot pattern is different. With its
stumbling movements, it evades opponents'
attacks brilliantly!

attacks.name: Dizzying Headbutt
attacks.effect: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

description:
It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean.
It wipes off dirt with its wings.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and
blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful
soprano.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
It can learn and speak human words. If they gather,
they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on
the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming
from behind.

When they see an enemy, their tails stand high,
and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their
cheek pouches.

attacks.name: Biting Fang
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

description:
This Pokémon is far brighter than the average
child, and Lillipup won't forget the love it
receives or any abuse it suffers.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

description:
The black fur that covers this Pokémon's body
is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce
right off.

Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive
moustache. It's said that moustache length is what
determines social standing among this species.

attacks.name: Dangerous Bite
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

description:
With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its
prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also
consumes berries, it's a carnivore at heart.

For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of
the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer,
but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

abilities.name: Fur Coat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

description:
Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer,
but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

description:
The females are fussier than the males. If another
creature dirties a female Rookidee's wings, it'll
peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.

This intelligent Pokémon will quickly learn how to
use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.

If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be
able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this
Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

description:
Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the
opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

description:
It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its
long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can
make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing
it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.

The one with the best drumming techniques
becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle
disposition and values harmony among its group.

abilities.name: Captivating Rhythm
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

description:
It's very friendly and faithful to people. It will try
to repel enemies by barking and biting.

In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of
lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—
or so it's said.

abilities.name: Slow Sear
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

description:
In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than
the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Waterfall Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card from your deck that evolves from this Pokémon onto this Pokémon to evolve it.

description:
If it hears festive music, it begins moving in
rhythm in order to amplify its power.

attacks.name: Rhythmic Steps
attacks.effect: If you have exactly 1, 3, or 5 cards in your hand, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky,
schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of
the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

abilities.name: Bouncy Body
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of
oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword.

description:
If you lick the ice covering its face, you'll find it
has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on
ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.

abilities.name: Ice Face
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon has full HP, it takes −40 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in
handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
There are many depictions of Cofagrigus
decorating ancient tombs. They're symbols
of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

attacks.name: Soul Shot
attacks.effect: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you can't discard 2 cards, this attack does nothing.

description:
Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers
that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin
bawling if you do.

It toughens up by slamming into thick trees
over and over. It gains a sturdy body and
dauntless spirit.

It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of
fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of
sand while attacking.

attacks.name: Crashing Fangs
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

description:
Though capable of flight, Archeops was
apparently better at hunting on the ground.

When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from
its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over
buildings.

description:
Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is
blindingly fast when catching its prey.

The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes.
It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles,
although no one has ever returned from there.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, once during your turn, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

description:
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp
as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong,
so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you
don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
It's one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When
Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with
a dazzling red glow.

attacks.name: Sky Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description:
If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't
open up to you. Even if you do grow close,
giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

description:
Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they've
grown close, but it's a powerful, sharp-clawed
Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

description:
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.
The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of
the Pokémon's innards showing through the skin.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Poliwag from your deck onto your Bench.

description:
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.
This trait of Poliwhirl's has been used in place of
lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through
cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to
smash through drift ice and plow forward.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

description:
It's said that this Pokémon's beautiful blue wings
are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy
mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description:
It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond
with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oceanic Gift
attacks.effect: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon.

description:
The balloons it inflates with its nose grow
larger and larger as it practices day by day.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
It gets excited when it sees a dance it
doesn't know. This hard worker practices
diligently until it can learn that dance.

This Pokémon has complete control over
electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in
the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.effect: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar.
It uses nimble steps to approach opponents,
then knocks them out with electric punches.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.effect: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex.

description:
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents
apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack,
they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Flash
abilities.effect: At the end of your first turn, take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats
the dreams of adults because children's are much
tastier.

When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use
a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and
Confusion.

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
Geodude that have lived a long life have had all
their edges smoothed out until they're totally
round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak
of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit,
it rolls back down the way it came.

When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their
shells. Those that have lived a long, long time
have shells green with moss.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

description:
This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young.
Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures,
but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card that evolves from Rockruff from your deck into your hand.

description:
The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat
caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.

All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night,
it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

description:
Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to
raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

attacks.name: Shadow Claw
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

description:
A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a
sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles
per hour.

An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the
three heads—even for a second—will get
pecked severely.

With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is
more agile and active than it appears.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.effect: Halve your opponent's Active Pokémon's remaining HP, rounded down.

attacks.name: Pierce the Pain
attacks.effect: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that have damage on them.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scar-Charged Smash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dimensional Storm
attacks.effect: Discard 3 {W} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lycanfang
attacks.effect: Discard a {F} Energy from this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Offload Pass
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move all {F} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triplet Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Metallic Turbo
attacks.effect: Take 2 {M} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Carefree Press
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ultimate Force
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fabled Luster
abilities.effect: This Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

description:
No matter how much time and money is spent
raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when
they bloom in the wild.

abilities.name: Toughness Aroma
abilities.effect: Each of your {G} Pokémon gets +20 HP.

description:
In the past, noble families entrusted their vault
keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down
through the generations, taking good care of it.

abilities.name: Dismantling Keys
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you do, discard this Pokémon.
